description:
Work around the multiple breakpad issue by never
initializing o3d's breakpad if loaded in the
Chrome Helper process.  Hopefully this is temporary
and we will revert once we get breakpad working
with multiple instances.


Committed: http://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome?view=rev&revision=77390

messages.text:
http://codereview.chromium.org/6639006/diff/4001/plugin/mac/plugin_mac.mm
File plugin/mac/plugin_mac.mm (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/6639006/diff/4001/plugin/mac/plugin_mac.mm#newcode317
plugin/mac/plugin_mac.mm:317: bool isBrowserChrome()
Google C++ style is a capital first letter, i.e. IsBrowseChrome(), and with the { on the same line.

http://codereview.chromium.org/6639006/diff/4001/plugin/mac/plugin_mac.mm#newcode333
plugin/mac/plugin_mac.mm:333: if (!gBreakpadRef && !isBrowserChrome()) {
Comment plz. Also get rid of trailing whitespace.

http://codereview.chromium.org/6639006/diff/4001/plugin/mac/plugin_mac.mm
File plugin/mac/plugin_mac.mm (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/6639006/diff/4001/plugin/mac/plugin_mac.mm#newcode333
plugin/mac/plugin_mac.mm:333: if (!gBreakpadRef && !isBrowserChrome()) {
On 2011/03/09 00:46:42, Tristan Schmelcher 2 wrote:
> Comment plz. Also get rid of trailing whitespace.

Needs comment on why we're not initializing in Chrome.

subject: Work around the multiple breakpad issue by never...
